A group of artist-activists have developed a multimedia archive of the Palestinian refugee camp of Burj al-Shamali in Lebanon. The project, “Frictional Conversations,” combines research, conversational practice, and performative interventions.
Nayrouz Abu Hatoum and Anna Shah Hoque examine themes of archival praxis, visual storytelling, and care through two Palestinian short films screened at the Palestine Film Festival in Toronto.

Israel killed 100 people in Gaza today. I listened to NPR this evening, and this wasn’t even reported in passing. There was even a report about an initiative to save endangered wolves somewhere, but no mention of the 100 people who were killed in less than 24 hours.

Israel killed more than 51 Palestinians in Gaza today, and just now there are reports of a massacre in Jabalia, where more than 40 people were killed in an attack on a building where people were sheltering. Today’s toll alone will likely surpass 100 dead and more injured.

Israel has employed every deranged method of brutality imaginable against the people of Gaza. Officials and civilians are reporting the use of weapons they have never experienced before. Gaza has become a testing ground for new weapons and tools of murder and destruction.

هل تعلم أن مدينة غزة إحتضنت أحد أهم المعاهد العلمية في عهد الإمبراطورية البيزنطية؟ بين نهاية القرن الخامس الميلادي وبداية القرن السادس، كانت "مدرسة غزة للخطابة" (The Rhetorical School of Gaza) من أهم المعاهد التي درست علوم الخطابة، والأدب، والثقافة والفكر الإغريقيين.

The significance of the ICC arrest warrants isn’t in the likelihood of their enforcement but in how they’ll hasten Israel and its allies’ efforts to dismantle the international order—one that was never just to us. Its collapse may give way to something better, or perhaps not.

While Israelis and their supporters are having the meltdown of the century over the ICC arrest warrant, Israel tonight continues to besiege, bomb, and attack hospitals in northern Gaza. They want to commit a genocide in silence without consequences.

The medicine and disease crisis in Gaza will be a “butterfly effect” that will sweep the entire world.. E.coli bacteria that infects the digestive system & urinary tract, in Gaza, a new strain has been produced that infects bone tissues was recorded for the first time!

ّI spoke to my uncle Abu Osama who miraculously emerged from the rubble of his home yesterday for the 2nd time during #GazaGenocide. Israel used AI robots to flatten their residential square in Beit-Lahia. Our conversation was devastating but serves as an account to a crime

Israel is committing nonstop massacres in Gaza as I type this. So much for the Biden-Harris administration lifting a finger to stop the slaughter. I don’t know how many more videos we can see of parents cradling their murdered children or children hugging their dead parents.

Imagine losing 50 to 100 members of your community every day for over a year. How can one grasp the scale of killing and loss of life in Gaza? Beyond the murdered are the injured, missing, amputated, disabled, elderly, children, and pregnant. Imagine their unimaginable suffering.

Israel, along with its allies and supporters in the West, rejects the accusation of genocide. Fine. But what do we call the daily killing of hundreds of people for over a year and the destruction and annihilation of entire communities, families, and towns?
Seventy Palestinians, the majority of them women and children, were killed by Israel in a single airstrike on a neighborhood near a hospital in northern Gaza.

It’s clear why Israel is killing more than 100 Palestinians daily in Gaza: not for the hostages, not to reach a political settlement, not to engage Hamas. It’s a deliberate campaign of ethnic cleansing, and an intensified attempt to eliminate and uproot an entire population.

Israel’s state and non-state allies appear content with its actions in Gaza, offering no pushback against the mass killing of an entire population. For them, Palestinian lives seem not to matter. They are normalizing a 21st-century model for population uprooting and elimination.

Why should this matter to you? What’s happening in Gaza sets a dangerous precedent for the fascist elimination of “unwanted” populations, now backed by the major institutions and of the “liberal” and “democratic” West. You will be next.

The Zionist idea is based on the premise that Palestinian and Arab lives don’t matter. The Zionist project maintains its existence by constantly trying to prove that our lives are disposable and don’t matter. This is an insane fascist project that needs to be stopped now.

One of the children who survived the devastating Israeli airstrikes in northern Gaza.

Israel is carrying out extermination in northern Gaza. This isn’t a term coined by me or other Palestinians to describe what’s happening. It was Israeli academics and generals who used the term extermination to describe plans for ending the Palestinian presence in northern Gaza.

Northern Gaza is being wiped out neighborhood by neighborhood while the world continues to watch. We’ve seen the worst of what humanity has to offer, and the world just looks the other way and keeps going.

The Israeli occupation army has committed a horrific massacre in the Beit Lahia project in northern Gaza, resulting in 73 martyrs so far and dozens of injured and missing, most of whom are women and children, following the bombardment of densely populated residential blocks.

The Beit Lahia massacre Israel just committed is even worse than initially thought. The death toll has now surpassed 70, mostly women and children, all from a single airstrike. Dozens more are injured or missing, and the numbers are rising as many are still unaccounted for.

Israel has just killed over 50 people in a single airstrike, and since this morning, more than 50 Palestinians have also been killed in Gaza. What do you call a situation where every single day, for months, 50 to 100 members of your community or nation are killed?
